definitions.definition: True facts, genuine depiction or statements of reality.
definitions.example: The truth is that our leaders knew a lot more than they were letting on.

definitions.definition: Conformity to fact or reality; correctness, accuracy.
definitions.example: There was some truth in his statement that he had no other choice.

definitions.definition: The state or quality of being true to someone or something.
definitions.example: Truth to one's own feelings is all-important in life.

definitions.definition: A pledge of loyalty or faith.
Conformity to rule; exactness; close correspondence with an example, mood, model, etc.
That which is real, in a deeper sense; spiritual or ‘genuine’ reality.
definitions.example: Alcoholism and redemption led me finally to truth.

definitions.definition: Something acknowledged to be true; a true statement or axiom.
definitions.example: Hunger and jealousy are just eternal truths of human existence.

definitions.definition: Topness; the property of a truth quark.
To assert as true; to declare; to speak truthfully.
To make exact; to correct for inaccuracy.
